title: SEIRP: search engines - information retrieval in practice
text:
Search engines - information retrieval in practice is a recommended book that shows a complete picture of search engine (web search, especially) and deliver detailed deep-dive into each engine components.
I would like to use a category called SEIRP to mark the posts about the book.
[[toc]]

title: SEIRP: search engines - information retrieval in practice
text:
Chapters in SEIRP

Search Engines and Infromation Retrieval
Architecture of a Search Engine
Crawls and Feeds
Processing Text
Ranking with Indexes
Queries and Interfaces
Retrieval Models
Evaluating Search Engines
Classification and Clustering
Social Search
Beyong Bag of Words

title: SEIRP: search engines - information retrieval in practice
section: Chapters that I would like to hightlight
text:
Chapters that I would like to hightlight

Chapter 2 - Architecture of a Search Engine
This chapter breaks down a search engine into well-define pieces, they are Text Acquisition, Text Transformation, Index Creation, User Interaction, Ranking, Evaluation.
We can imagine a search pipeline like below picture:




flowchart TD
info(Information Contents)
usr(End User)
crlr(Crawler)
cp(Content Processer)
idx[(Search Index)]
qry(Query Interface)
anly(Analsis)

info --> crlr
crlr --> cp
cp --> idx
idx --> qry
cp -.-> anly
qry -.->anly
anly --> qry
qry --> usr

title: Getting started with personal blog
text:
This is my personal blog. I’d like to make it a technical notebook that records interesting ideas I read, I’m thinking, and to share with you.
October, 2022

title: Zipf’s law (draft)
text:
\[
f(k; s, N) = \frac{1/k^s}{\displaystyle \sum_{n=1}^N (1/n^s)}
\]
